common_issues.title: Pieces OS Account Linking and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users report problems linking Google and GitHub accounts, with only one connecting at a time. Others experience app crashes after OS updates, requiring troubleshooting or manual account merging by support. Issues persist across OS versions and platforms.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User (@johnkennyuk) is experiencing issues with account linking and wants to merge their Github and Google accounts.
* User identified that they should have only one account, but due to previous bugs, two accounts were created.

**Problems identified:**

* Existing account linking flow is not user-friendly.
* User has two separate accounts instead of one.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark from Pieces Support will manually merge the two accounts.
* The user's Google account with the custom domain will be the main account.
* User will need to sign out and sign back in after the merge.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Mark from Pieces Support has identified the user's accounts and the main account has been determined.
* User will need to provide the second email address to complete the merge.
* Once the merge is complete, the user will no longer experience issues with account linking.

**Additional notes:**

* The user is comfortable with the merge process and is confident they will be able to complete it successfully.
* The issue will be resolved once the user provides the second email address and the merge is completed.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update Causes App Download and Installation Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties downloading and installing Ollama models and Pieces OS updates across Linux, Windows, and macOS. The issues stem from sandboxing restrictions, potential bugs in the update process, and unspecified download errors. Proposed solutions include patching for sandbox compatibility, bug fixes, and providing alternative download methods.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Summary of GitHub issue conversation:
**Key Points:**
* User is unable to complete downloading process due to `curl` error.
* User confirms having `curl` installed, identifying the issue as sandboxing within Pieces-OS snap. 
* Developer acknowledges the issue and clarifies the confinement mode.
* Infrastructure updates delayed the fix, which is now in progress.

**Problems Identified:**
* Pieces-OS snap sandboxing restricts access to `curl`, impacting downloading.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
* Patching to allow Pieces-OS to use Ollama within the sandbox environment.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
* Fix is in progress, with an expected release in the coming week.

**Additional Requests:**
* User requests a workaround or local download option while the fix is pending.
* Other users express the need for a resolution.

**Open Questions:**
* Availability of alternative download methods during the fix implementation.

recommendations: **Prioritize account linking issues:** Many users are experiencing problems with account linking, particularly with Google and GitHub accounts. This issue has been persistent for some users, causing frustration and potentially impacting adoption. Focus on resolving the root cause of these account linking problems and improve the user experience for connecting multiple accounts.

**Investigate and address Pieces OS update problems:** Several users reported issues after updating Pieces OS, including app crashes, launch failures, and download errors. These issues appear across different operating systems, suggesting a potential problem with the update process itself. Thoroughly test and address these issues to ensure a smooth update experience for all users.

**Improve model download and installation process:** Users are encountering difficulties downloading and installing Ollama models, particularly on Linux due to sandboxing restrictions. Explore solutions like patching for sandbox compatibility, providing alternative download methods, or offering clearer instructions to resolve these issues and make model installation seamless.

**Provide more detailed documentation and troubleshooting guides:** While the support bot offers helpful resources, expanding documentation and troubleshooting guides for common issues like account linking, update problems, and model installation can empower users to resolve problems independently and reduce the strain on support resources.

**Consider a dedicated bug reporting and tracking system:** While GitHub Issues serve as a platform for reporting problems, a dedicated bug reporting and tracking system could provide a more structured approach to managing and prioritizing issues. This system could include features like issue templates, severity levels, and progress updates to improve communication and transparency with users.
